name: Slide
description: Any movement made by a system or action with the Slide movement type ignores Engagement and does not trigger Reactions.

name: Experimental
description: When you activate a weapon or system with this tag, after any other effects resolve roll 1d6. If the result is greater than or equal to X, trigger the Experimental effect. If a weapon or system has multiple Experimental effects, roll a single die to determine the outcome for all of them.

name: Kickstart
description: When you activate this weapon or system, if you meet its Kickstart condition, it gains a burst of energy that makes it easier to use. For systems or weapons, they can be activated or fired as a free action instead of their usual action cost. This does not count as a skirmish or barrage for weapons. If it is a reaction then it can ignore any X/round use restrictions, but it still consumes a reaction for the turn. If the Kickstart condition was the effect of an action you took (ex: ‘you knock a character Prone’), the Kickstart system must be the very next action you take after the triggering action resolves without interruption or the benefit is lost.

name: Supercharge
description: When you activate a weapon or system with this tag, you can Supercharge it to gain the listed effect. If it has no listed effect, the entire activation counts as Supercharging it. After doing so, you cannot Supercharge it again until the end of the  mission.
